job_title: Mental Health Technician in McKinney, TX
pros: Great pay that can be negotiated, unlimited overtime, great coworkers who can relate to any troubles/hardships, great schedule
cons: not guaranteed a home unit and have to get floated to ER and different parts of the hospital with no help or previous knowledge of assignments, limited protection when sitting 1:1 on other units due to improper communication lines with other staff, other shifts can be late causing to clock out late, management hosts meetings for feedback but don't take into consideration, high turn over rate, you may be scheduled for a unit all day and then 30 minutes before clocking in you'll be in a different place

pros: Good working environment and support management and staff.
cons: The workload can be overwhelming sometimes.

job_title: Behavioral Health RN in McKinney, TX
pros: The people here are top-notch, and the DON is really kind and empathetic with staff. Patients can be challenging but are for the most part manageable. Pay and benefits are about as can be expected. Not awesome, but not terrible.
cons: There's a pretty high turnover, and some negativity, especially on the geriatric unit, which is more challenging than the rest. A lot of medical patients on the geri floor, which makes things more difficult and stressful if you're there majority of the time. Pay raises are really poor.

pros: The people and the leaders.
cons: Not the highest paying hospital system in Dallas area.

review_title: Great training, resources, and higher management.
job_title: Mental Health Technician in McKinney, TX
pros: The staff is extremely helpful and the nurses help in any way that they can and don't make you feel bothersome if there's any help you may need. There's constant positive reinforcement from every angel if you do your job correctly. The schedule is completely perfect for a work/life balance and overtime is available if needed. There's monthly meetings and check-ins about your mental help and wins/loss for the months. Coaching is available at all times for the higher-level techs and tech coordinators! If there's any situation that happens with patients no need to feel uncomfortable because the staff ensures that we are protected and safe to the best of their ability and things are handled swiftly.
cons: The main downside is training on a unit and becoming comfortable then having to move to different parts of the hospitals or units you aren't training correctly on. For example, moving to the ER and not being trained on their duties, roles and expectations. You feel like you should almost apply for safety attendant, ER tech, and sitter for the way you can be pulled- also it sucks that if they're overstaffed you don't have the choice to go to another unit or be sent home.

review_title: The experience has been great--this facility has done a lot to change the culture, quality, and service in recent years!
pros: Vast resources from division and corporation, lots of systems in place to make things easier---no one has to reinvent the wheel, yet they are open to innovation and new ideas.  Several division and one national HCA innovator's Award winners here at Medical Center of McKinney!
cons: The challenges are those faced by most large companies---shared services can leave you less control over outcomes that impact your facility at times, but with persistence, outcomes data and communication, you can work through most issues and make improvements where needed.

pros: Get overtime if wanted but don't have to.  Great if you are going to school.  Supervisor is willing to work around schedule.
cons: Work alone unless on days.  You can't leave the office until someone else is there to cover.  If your replacement is late you have to stay over.  If you need a day off that is not scheduled, you have to find your own coverage.  If someone leaves the company the team has to pick up the extra shift.

pros: opportunities for advancement are available. coworkers are great. fair pay. My first interview was with recruiter over the phone. 2nd interview was over the phone one week later. Offer letter was sent by email.
cons: If you are not doing direct patient care you are disposable. It is all about the bottom line. Constantly understaffed.

pros: I worked at a Hospital in the past as a security Officer and have knowledge of the operation. I was also a shift Lieutenant at a prison for 15 year, I supervised 40 Officers and 300 inmates, I recently did security at a warehouse. I also assisted the cooks, nurses and visitors at the hospital.
cons: Know basic computer skill but improving daily
